src_text: Phethagat o ya Mananeo a Bohlokwa a Mmu o Kabinete e lakalet a baithuti ka moka t e dibotse ge ba thoma ka ditlhahlobo t a bona t a mafelelo a ngwag Baithuti ba Mphato wa 2016 ba hlohlelet wa go dula ba nepi it e ge ba thoma Ditlhahlobo t a Lengwalo la Marematlou t a 2016 t eo di thomago semmu o ka la 24 Diphalane 2016 gomme t a fela ka la 29 Dibatsela 2012.
trg_text: Implementation of Key Government Programmes Cabinet wishes all students well as they embark on their final year examination The Class of 2016 are encouraged to stay focussed as they embark on 2016 National Senior Certificate Examinations which officially starts on 24 October 2016 and ends on 29 November 2012.

trg_text: Cabinet wishes to reiterate its call for the country to support all efforts to save the 2016 academic programm These efforts led by government through the Ministerial Task Team working with students, parents, universities and stakeholders are a demonstration of our collective commitment to find solutions to normalise our higher education sectoCabinet shares the sentiments expressed by students with regards to the challenges they face on high costs of tuition fees, accommodation, textbooks, transport and living expenseIf the academic year is lost, the universities and colleges do not reach a finality this year, almost a million matriculants will not be admitted into higher education, in 2017.

Cabinet welcomed the R3 billion investment by Marriot International that will see the world s largest hotel group complete five new hotel The announcement demonstrates the investor confidence in the country and positive future prospects of the local econom South Africa was named as the best country for debt management and sovereign bond issuance in sub-Saharan Africa by Emerging Markets Newspaper, an affiliate of the IMF/World Bank Annual Meeting The award comes after the World Bank acknowledged the country s excellence in debt dynamics/compositio These accolades are a testament to the success the country continues to enjoy in global capital markets and the prudent manner in which the economy is manage The first Kenyan State Visit by a South African head of state, President Jacob Zuma, since democracy, included a business delegation to the Kenya-South Africa Business Forum, which explored investment and trade opportunitie The following Memorandums of Understanding were signed: police cooperation, biodiversity conservation and management and the Lamu-Port Southern Sudan-Ethiopia Transport Corrido The Second Session of the Bi-National Commission between the South Africa and the Republic of Namibia underscored our collective commitment with a range of bilateral, regional and international issues being reviewe The Memorandum of Understanding on Higher Education has been finalised, including the signing of the Terms of Reference of the Joint Committee of Experts on the Orange River Boundar Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa s working visit to Vietnam and Singapore was used to unlock future areas of trade and investment, and to attract Singaporean State Owned Enterprises to invest in South Africa through Public Private Partnerships, in line with South Africa's Nine-Point Pla Commitment was also secured for Singapore to assist South Africa with skills development and to increase the number of training courses for South African students offered under the Singapore Co-operation Programm President Jacob Zuma addressed the annual South African Heads of Mission Conference which provided a platform for all our heads of mission to share ideas on issues and priorities which better enables them to continue representing our countr As our representatives abroad they have a responsibility to build friendships and partnerships that will help us achieve our goals from the National Development Plan, that of inclusive growth, jobs and a decent life for our peopl In responding to the needs of communities and businesses, Minister of Water and Sanitation Nomvula Mokonyane will turn the sod for the construction of Phase One of the R18 billion Vaal Gamagara Water Project, this Friday, 21 October 2016.

trg_text: As Transport Month unfolds a number of key transport infrastructure projects and initiatives are being rolled out to better connect people and places, which is creating new jobs and changing the way South Africans traveIn this regard Cabinet recognises the R24 million investment by the Gauteng Department for Roads and Transport to repair the D904 road, which is also known as the old Evaton Roa The rehabilitation of the existing road will lead to improved travelling time, and will ensure better road safety for motorists, cyclists and pedestrian.

trg_text: Cabinet is confident that Advocate Mkhwebane will serve the nation well and will continue to act in the best interest of all South African Cabinet expresses its gratitude to Advocate Thuli Madonsela for serving the country and placing the office of the Public Protector uppermost in the minds of citizen Cabinet joins South Africa's media in commemorating the anniversary of Media Freedom Day known as "Black Wednesday" and commends the media industry for the role they have played in strengthening the country's democrac On 19 October 1977, the apartheid regime ordered The World and Weekend World to cease publication and sparked the mass detention and banning of journalistOur democratic Constitution explicitly protects our hard fought media freedoms that are recognised as playing a critical role in the advancement of national unity and equality for alAs we reflect on the progress South Africa has made in entrenching media freedom, Cabinet congratulates SANEF on its 20th anniversary which will be celebrated next wee Cabinet extends the hand of solidarity to the people of Nigeria and to the families of the girls who remain in captivity, following the news that 21 of the 2019 schoolgirls kidnapped by Boko Haram militants have been free Cabinet calls on the international community to renew its efforts in assisting the Nigerian authorities to secure the girls' release; in particular for all African countries and the African Union to lend support to assisting Nigeria in finding the missing childre Cabinet joins President Jacob Zuma in extending condolences to the Government and people of the Republic of Haiti and other nations in the Caribbean following destructive Hurricane Matthew that claimed the lives of hundreds of people and destroyed infrastructur Cabinet joins President Zuma in extending condolences to the government and people of the Kingdom of Thailand following the passing of King Bhumibol Adulyade.

trg_text: The launch of the R49-million first phase of the revitalised Isithebe Industrial Park in Mandeni, KwaZulu-Natal, forms part of the Revitalisation of Industrial Parks Programme of the Department of Trade and Industry, and has been prioritised for renewaThe aim is to regenerate state-owned industrial parks across the country in order to promote industrialisation and increase their contribution to job creation and the country s economic growt Industries operating from Isithebe contribute significantly to the economy of the area, providing over 20 000 job During the revitalisation programme 15 small micro medium enterprises were appointed for the project to the value of Rmillion with 162 people employe.

trg_text: Cabinet also sends condolences to the family and friends of struggle icon Mewa Ramgobi He founded the South African Committee for the release of Political Prisoners, and was among the first supporters of the Release Mandela campaig Mewa Ramgobin was also the former President of the Natal Indian Congress and Chairperson of Phoenix Settlement Trust, founded by Mahatma Gandhi in 19011.

Tsebi o, ya gore Afrika Borwa e tla holega kwanong ye mpsha ya kgwebo le Kopano ya Yuropa (EU), e tla bona phihlelelo ye e kaonafadit ego go dit welet wa t a Afrika Borwa t e di nago le phihlelelo ya mmaraka wo o it ego ka E Tumelelano ya Tiri ano ya Ekonomi (EPA) ka fase ga tlhako ya SADC-EU-EPA e ema legato melawana ya kgwebo ya tumelelano ya gonabjale ya mohlakanelwa gareng ga Afrika Borwa le EU, ye e bit wago Tumelelano ya Kgwebo, Tlhabollo le Tiri ano (TDCA).
trg_text: The announcement, that South Africa will benefit from a new trade deal with the European Union (EU), will see improved access for South African products having preferential market access in the E The Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) under the SADC-EU EPA framework replaces the trade provisions of the existing bilateral trade agreement between South Africa and the EU, known as the Trade, Development and Cooperation Agreement (TDCA).

src_text: EPA e fa phihlelelo ya mmaraka wo mofsa wa swikiri le ethanol gammogo le phihlelelo ye e kaonafadit wego ya mmaraka wa beine, mat oba, dit wamaswing le dit welet wa t a dienyw.
trg_text: The EPA provides new market access for sugar and ethanol as well as improved market access for wines, flowers, dairy and fruit product.

src_text: Khomi ene ya Pabalelo ya Tuna ya Bluefin ya Borwa e okedit e Palomoka ya Go swarwa mo Go dumelet ego mo Afrika Borwa go kabo ya Tuna ya Bluefin ya Borwa go tloga go ditone t e 150 go ya go ditone t e 450 mo dihleng t a go rea dihlapi t a 2018-2020.
trg_text: The Commission for the Conservation of Southern Bluefin Tuna has increased South Africa s Total Allowable Catch of the Southern Bluefin Tuna allocation from 150 tons to 450 tons for the 2018-2020 fishing season This is essential to South Africa s job creation priorities as it will provide permanent employment in the fisheries sector and will inject much needed export revenue for the countr.

src_text: ye 13 524 ka tiri Mola thulagayo ya go agwa ga mohlagase ka Afrika Borwa go tleaganywa le tlhabollo ya dithoto t a dibe wa t a fosile, naga e ikgafet e go phetogelo go ekonomi ya khapone ya fase, ba beile pele dipeobakeng t a mohlagase wa go hlwek Ka Mohlagase wo o Mpshafat wago, 6 376 MW ya mohlagase di hwedit we go Bat welet i ba Mohlagase ba Go ikema ba 102 mo dihlopheng t e tshela t a go ab Mo go t e, 2 200 MW ya maatla a t welet o ya mohlagase go t wa go diprot eke t e 44 t a IPP di kgokagant we go kriti ya set hab.
trg_text: Contributions can be sent through Facebook: National Treasury South Africa, Twitter @TreasuryRSA, oral representations and the National Treasury website Key Cabinet decisions Cabinet approved the broad principles of the National Transport Master Plan 2050 (NATMAP) Synopsis Update Report, which is aligned to the National Development Plan and has the following strategic transport thrusts: long term planning and prioritisation, focusing on safety, reliability and affordability of transport; looking beyond transport as most inefficiencies and ills are the result of poor land use and planning; promoting behavioural change by changing the perception of public transport; and a developmental and socially inclusive planning approac Cabinet approved submission of the revised International Telecommunication Regulations (ITRs), Dubai 2012, to Parliament for ratificatioThe ITRs constitute an international treaty, and forms part of the Administrative Regulations of the International Telecommunications Unio The ITRs are aligned to the National Development Plan, in particular the promotion of economic growth and greater inclusion through the development of a stronger broadband and telecommunications network and lower price Cabinet approved the submission of the World Radio Communication Conference (WRC-15) Final Acts, to Parliament for ratification, in line with Section 231(2) of the ConstitutioKey issues adopted at the WRC-15 include universal broadband roll-out, universal broadcasting roll-out, satellite communication services, aircraft services, maritime and the ocean economy programmes, disaster relief and emergency services, as well as future programmes to support economic transformatio WRC-15 outcomes also provides certainty to broadcasting service by protecting Digital Terrestrial Television (DTT) spectru Cabinet approved submission of the Final Acts of the International Telecommunications Union (ITU) Plenipotentiary Conference of Guadalajara 2010, to Parliament for ratification in terms of Section 231(2) of the ConstitutioThe Plenipotentiary Conference is the top policy-making body of the ITU, which is a specialised agency of the United Nations responsible for managing the global system of electronic communicationThe work of the ITU is aligned to the National Development Plan, as it is strongly focused on the development of Economic Infrastructure in the ICT secto Cabinet was briefed on the progress made on the establishment and implementation of the Broadband War Roo The August 2016 Cabinet Lekgotla resolved that the Broadband War Room must be established to expedite the implementation of SA Connect, the national broadband policAs part of the Terms of Reference of the war room, several critical issues were identified that have a direct impact on the successful rollout of affordable, fast, reliable and secure interne These include; addressing the delays in the allocation of high demand spectrum; broadband connectivity; rollout and funding; addressing ineffective market structures; fast-tracking digital broadcasting migration; development of e-government strategy; rationalisation of ICT State-Owned Entities; and capacitating the Regulator and addressing duplicity in governance of the ICT secto Cabinet approved that the Paris Agreement on Climate Change be submitted to Parliament for ratificatio The Paris Agreement is a legal instrument that will further guide the process for universal action on climate chang It brings all nations into a common cause of acting collectively to the threat of climate change, in the context of sustainable development and efforts to eradicate povert It sets the goal of holding the increase in global average temperature to well below 2 degrees CelsiuThe Paris Agreement will enter into force on 4 November 2016, thirty days after the date on which at least 55 Parties to the Convention accounting in total for at least 55 % of the total global greenhouse gas emissions have deposited their instruments of ratificatioSouth Africa's ratification of the Paris Agreement sends a positive signal of our continued commitment to contribute to the global effort to address the challenge of climate chang Cabinet approved the Draft National Policy on Extension and Advisory Services and its implementation Pla The Policy aims to set a regulatory framework to enhance the efficiency, productivity, equity, environmental and economic sustainability of the agriculture, forestry and fisheries sector This will ensure that all sectors in the agriculture, forestry and fisheries value chains (from producers to processors) are able to explore opportunities for the advancement of their enterprises and livelihood Cabinet approved the final draft of the refined Medium Term Strategic Framework (MTSF) 2014-2019 for Outcome 2
